class.name: FieldLUDecomposition

javadoc.text:
Calculates the LUP-decomposition of a square matrix. *

The LUP-decomposition of a matrix A consists of three matrices * L, U and P that satisfy: PA = LU, L is lower triangular, and U is * upper triangular and P is a permutation matrix. All matrices are * m×m.

*

Since {@link FieldElement field elements} do not provide an ordering * operator, the permutation matrix is computed here only in order to avoid * a zero pivot element, no attempt is done to get the largest pivot * element.

*

This class is based on the class with similar name from the * JAMA library.

*
    *
  • a {@link #getP() getP} method has been added,
    • *
  • the {@code det} method has been renamed as {@link #getDeterminant()getDeterminant},
    • *
  • the {@code getDoublePivot} method has been removed (but the int based{@link #getPivot() getPivot} method has been kept),
    • *
  • the {@code solve} and {@code isNonSingular} methods have been replaced * by a {@link #getSolver() getSolver} method and the equivalent methods * provided by the returned {@link DecompositionSolver}.
    • *
javadoc.param: <T> * the type of the field elements

javadoc.text: Field to which the elements belong.
Entries of LU decomposition.
Pivot permutation associated with LU decomposition.
Parity of the permutation associated with the LU decomposition.
Singularity indicator.
Cached value of L.
Cached value of U.
Cached value of P.
Calculates the LU-decomposition of the given matrix.
javadoc.throws: NonSquareMatrixException if matrix is not square

method.name: FieldLUDecomposition
method.comment: try to select a better permutation choice
Divide the lower elements by the "winning" diagonal elt.

javadoc.text:
Returns the matrix L of the decomposition. *

L is a lower-triangular matrix
javadoc.return: the L matrix (or null if decomposed matrix is singular)

javadoc.text:
Returns the matrix U of the decomposition. *

U is an upper-triangular matrix
javadoc.return: the U matrix (or null if decomposed matrix is singular)

javadoc.text:
Returns the P rows permutation matrix. *

P is a sparse matrix with exactly one element set to 1.0 in * each row and each column, all other elements being set to 0.0.

*

The positions of the 1 elements are given by the {@link #getPivot()pivot permutation vector}.
javadoc.return: the P rows permutation matrix (or null if decomposed matrix is singular)

javadoc.text: Returns the pivot permutation vector.
Return the determinant of the matrix.
Get a solver for finding the A × X = B solution in exact linear sense.
Specialized solver.
Field to which the elements belong.
Entries of LU decomposition.
Pivot permutation associated with LU decomposition.
Singularity indicator.
Build a solver from decomposed matrix.
javadoc.param: field field to which the matrix elements belong
pivot pivot permutation associated with LU decomposition

javadoc.text: {@inheritDoc}
{@inheritDoc}

Solve the linear equation A × X = B. *

The A matrix is implicit here. It is
javadoc.param: b right-hand side of the equation A × X = B
javadoc.return: a vector X such that A × X = B
javadoc.throws: DimensionMismatchException if the matrices dimensions do not match.
SingularMatrixException if the decomposed matrix is singular.

javadoc.text: {@inheritDoc}
